alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 14 at 2:31AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Carroll, Gorham, Bartlett, Jefferson, Jackson, Albany, and Chatham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
